metadata.Title: CVE-2022-3312 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Insufficient validation of untrusted input in VPN in Google Chrome on ChromeOS prior to 106.0.5249.62 allowed a local attacker to bypass managed device restrictions via physical access to the device. (Chromium security severity: Medium)

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-3312` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 107.0.5304.87-0ubuntu11.18.04.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 107.0.5304.87-0ubuntu11.18.04.1
chromium-chromedriver - 107.0.5304.87-0ubuntu11.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 107.0.5304.87-0ubuntu11.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 107.0.5304.87-0ubuntu11.18.04.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: alexmurray> The Debian chromium source package is called chromium-browser in Ubuntu mdeslaur> starting with Ubuntu 19.10, the chromium-browser package is just a script that installs the Chromium snap

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '107.0.5304.87-0ubuntu11.18.04.1').
